verses.roman:
kabhu bhāvonmāde prabhu iti-uti dhāya
bhūme paḍi' kabhu mūrcchā, kabhu gaḍi' yāya

synonyms: kabhu—sometimes; bhāva-unmāde—in the madness of ecstatic love; prabhu—Śrī Caitanya Mahāprabhu; iti-uti—here and there; dhāya—runs; bhūme paḍi'-falling on the ground; kabhu mūrcchā—sometimes unconscious; kabhu—sometimes; gaḍi' yāya—rolls on the ground.
translation: He sometimes ran here and there in the madness of ecstasy and sometimes fell and rolled on the ground. Sometimes He became completely unconscious.
